Tutorial: Install Android on Photon

Based on post of Tzacapaca:
http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=1002178

1.Download Android for photon.
Latest release (29.04.2011)
https://rapidshare.com/files/459829976/29.04.2011.rar
http://ge.tt/7TgKPNd?c

2.copy the files from the folder named for_sd_card to the root of SD card

3. remove your SIM card before the first boot

4. run HARET_PHOTON7227.exe (on the root of your SD card)

5. wait 5-10 min...
Android should boot over Windows!


What to do if Android wont boot:
- try format your SDcard using this tool:
https://www.rapidshare.com/files/453829327/setup.exe
format SD card instructions:
1.perform FULL ERASE,or FULL OVERWRITE 
2.go on "My Computer",right click on card and format it again FAT32
- if you still have issues with boot, go buy a new SDCard. usualy Kingston gives good results, as well as some unbranded cards. See xda forum for help.


Known issues:
-GPS software in WM will not find satellites if you turn off GPS from location settings in Android
-if you lower ringtone volume in Android you will also have lower ringtone in WM(even if it's on maximum)
-complete list of issues here:
-3G/GPRS connection is not working
complete issue list here:
http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=1073817

Wi-Fi static IP setup: (if DHCP dont work)
go on Wireless & networks,Wi-fi settings and click home button,advanced,use static IP and add an IP and the rest of settings from your network range,click back button and that's it.
